content: knit one stitch for every slipped stitch on the edge of the flap which should be half the total number of heel flap row for example if you knit 32 row for the heel flap you will pick up 16 sts pick up one additional stitch between the heel flap and the instep needle knit the instep stitches in the established k2 p2 ribbing pattern pick up and knit one stitch between the end of the instep and the start of the heel flap then pick up the same number of stitches along the second side of the heel flap as you did for the first side k to end of round marker as you knit arrange your stitches so that all of your gusset and sole stitches are on one side of your circular needle and the 32 36 instep stitches are on the other your end of round marker will be in the center of the gusset/sole stitches gusset decreases round 1 decrease round k to 3 sts before end of sole needle k2tog k1 knit instep sts in established ribbing pattern on sole needle - k1 ssk k to marker round 2 straight round k sole stitches knit instep sts in established ribbing pattern k to end of round repeat rounds 1 & 2 above until there are 32 36 sts remaining on sole needle instep needle has maintained 32 36 sts so you are back to your beginning stitch count foot continue to knit sole stitches in stockinette and instep stitches in ribbing until sock is 2 shorter than your final length make sure to try it on before starting the toe toe remove marker knit to end of sole stitches this is your new start of round round 1 k all stitches round 2 k1 ssk k until 3 sts are left on instep needle k2tog k1 repeat on sole needle repeat rounds 1 & 2 for the toe until you have 20 stitches left 10 on each needle or until desired final length is achieved ending with a decrease round kitchener/graft the remaining stitches together weave in ends and wear
